# Omeka
The Madoc platform is built upon the free Open source software Omeka-S.

<img src="data:image/png;base64," />


<div class="fesk-featured fesk-featured--omeka">
  <div class="fesk-grid">
    <div class="fesk-grid__third">
        <h4>Omeka S</h4>
        <p>
           Omeka S is a next-generation web publishing platform for institutions interested in connecting digital cultural heritage collections with other resources online.
        </p>
        <a class="fesk-button fesk-button--primary" target="_blank" href="https://omeka.org/s/">View website</a>
    </div>
    <div class="fesk-grid__third">
        <h4>User manual</h4>
        <p>
            Definitive documentation for using Omeka and configuring sites and writing content. You will find all references to much of Omeka's Admin user interface here.
        </p>
        <a class="fesk-button fesk-button--link" 
        target="_blank" href="https://omeka.org/s/docs/user-manual/admin/users/">
        View user manual
        </a>
    </div>
    <div class="fesk-grid__third">
        <h4>Developers</h4>
        <p>
            This site contains documentation of Omeka S intended for developers, people seeking to modify existing code, and people wanting to contribute potential improvements.
        </p>
        <a class="fesk-button fesk-button--link" 
        target="_blank" href="https://omeka.org/s/docs/developer/">View documentation</a>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
